register.name: WATCHDOG_ENABLE
register.comment: Writing '1' enables the watchdog regardless of its previous state and resets its state machine to 0.

register.name: WATCHDOG_DISABLE
register.comment: NOTE VALUES CHANGED FOR MAXWELL Writing the 3 disable codes in sequence to this register will disable the watchdog. Writing WATCHDOG_DEBUG_CODE3 instead of WATCHDOG_DISABLE_CODE3 will set the watchdog into debug mode. Each correct code written will advance the WATCHDOG_STATUS by 1 until it reaches 3. A status of 3 indicates that the watchdog has been disabled A status of 4 indicates that the watchdog is in debug mode. If an incorrect code is written at any time, the status will revert to 0 (enabled). The watchdog will not stop counting down until all three codes have been written correctly.

register.name: WATCHDOG_KICK
register.comment: Writing to this register causes the countdown value to be reset to the value stored in WATCHDOG_DELAY.

register.name: WATCHDOG_KICK_PENDING
register.comment: This indicates that WATCHDOG_KICK has been written to recently, but has not yet been transferred to the slow clock domain to reset the countdown value.

register.name: WATCHDOG_SLOW_KICK_PENDING
register.comment: This indicates that the WATCHDOG_KICK has got as far as the slow clock domain, and the countdown reset will occur on the next slow clock edge.

register.name: WATCHDOG_STATUS
register.comment: This indicates the current status of the enable/disable state machine. The states are: 0 - Enabled; 1 - Disable1; 2 - Disable2; 3 - Disabled; 4 - Debug mode. The watchdog is not fully disabled until it is in state 3. In addition, bit 3 is set if the watchdog has fired in debug mode.

register.name: MILDRED_INT_EN
register.comment: Interrupt enable.

register.name: MILDRED_INT_VECTOR_HI
register.comment: Interrupt vector top 8 bits.

register.name: MILDRED_INT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt status. Write to clear.

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_0

register.name: WPLL_CONTROLS_1

register.name: MILDRED_P0_RISING_MASK
register.comment: Bits 07:00 of the PIO rising edge interrupt mask register. The contents of this register are ANDed with MILDRED_P0_RISING and if any bits are 1 an interrupt is raised.

register.name: MILDRED_P1_RISING_MASK

register.name: MILDRED_P1_FALLING_MASK
register.comment: Bits 15:08 of the PIO falling edge interrupt mask register.

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_31_24
register.comment: This read-only register is 32-bit a free-running slow clock counter

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_23_16
register.comment: This read-only register is 32-bit a free-running slow clock counter

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_15_08
register.comment: This read-only register is 32-bit a free-running slow clock counter

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_STATUS_07_00
register.comment: This read-only register is 32-bit a free-running slow clock counter

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_31_24
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 8 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 150 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_23_16
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 8 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 150 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_15_08
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 8 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 150 hours

register.name: WATCHDOG_DELAY_07_00
register.comment: This is the reset value for the watchdog countdown. The reset value is 0xFFFF which allows a countdown period of 8 seconds. The maximum value of 0xFFFFFFFF allows for a sleep time of around 150 hours

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_0700_DRIVE_ENABLE
register.comment: Bits [ 7: 0] of PIO drive enable bus. These 8 PIO drive enable bits are bit-addressable to allow convenient switching for use with e.g. I2C.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[7:0] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[7:0] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_0700_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[7:0] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables the PIO[15:8] inputs individually to allow them to create a deep sleep wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_INVERT
register.comment: This register inverts the PIO[15:8] inputs individually before feeding them into the deep sleep wakeup logic. A 1 on the resulting bit may cause a wakeup event.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_PIO_1508_WAKEUP_STICKY
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of the PIO[15:8] deep sleep wakeup activities. Clear the sticky activity flops by writing 1 to DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_CLR_PIO.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_CMD
register.comment: This register is used to trigger events in the sleep block

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES0
register.comment: This register controls the sources which can cause deep sleep wakeup. Functions are enabled by setting individual bits. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS0
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY0
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS, recording all wakeup events since it was last cleared. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP_ENABLES1
register.comment: This register controls the sources which can cause deep sleep wakeup. Functions are enabled by setting individual bits. Bits are enumerated as DEEP_SLEEP_WAKEUP.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS1
register.comment: This register indicates the currently-active deep sleep wakeup sources.

register.name: DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS_STICKY1
register.comment: This register returns a sticky version of DEEP_SLEEP_STATUS, recording all wakeup events since it was last cleared.

register.name: MILDRED_PIO_1508_DRIVE_ENABLE
register.comment: Bits [15: 8] of PIO drive enable bus. These 8 PIO drive enable bits are bit-addressable to allow convenient switching for use with e.g. I2C.

register.name: MILDRED_MISC_CONTROL

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_23_16
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered.

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_15_08
register.comment: When the timer matches this count a deep sleep wakeup event will be triggered.

register.name: SLOW_CLK_TIMER_EVENT_07_00

register.name: PCR_WL_ADC_LDO_CTRL

register.name: PCR_WL_DAC_I_CTRL

register.name: PCR_WL_DAC_Q_CTRL
register.comment: DAC Q Control register (via inverter for bits 21 and 8) see SC-505788 for details

register.name: PCR_WL_DAC_MISC_CTRL
register.comment: DAC misc controls see SC-505788 for details

register.name: TCKR_ALARM1_BT

register.name: TCKR_ALARM2_BT

register.name: TCKR_ALARM0_WLAN

register.name: TCKR_ALARM1_WLAN

register.name: TCKR_TIMESTAMP_CTRL

register.name: TCKR_TIMESTAMP1_COARSE_VAL

register.name: TCKR_CTRL1_WLAN

register.name: CLKGEN_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: This register selects which of a variety of debug buses are driven out of the block

register.name: CLKGEN_TIMER_FAST_STATUS
register.comment: This read-only register contains the current value of the fast timer. It is used to set time changes on PIOs to implement serial buses. The value is in units of 12.5ns (80MHz) and it is free running all the time that the CLKGEN_TIMER_FAST_EN bit in CLKGEN_TIMER_ENABLES is set.

register.name: CLKGEN_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables many of the core clocks on the chip. When a corresponding bit is set, the clock is enabled, regardless of any corresponding clock request

register.name: CLKGEN_PP_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables processor platform clocks. When a corresponding bit is set, the clock is enabled, regardless of any corresponding clock request

register.name: CLKGEN_WL_ENABLES
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with wireless LAN specific clocks

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_ENABLES
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with wireless LAN baseband specific clocks

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_ENABLES
register.comment: This register is logically an extension of CLKGEN_ENABLES, but contains bits associated with LDPC specific clocks

register.name: CLKGEN_CLKMAC_SLEEP_CONFIG
register.comment: This register selects which of the clock requests and the Mac Activity input are capable of forcing the Clk20MRadio clock to be active. This could be useful to software in controlling sleep modes for the Mac Accelerator.

register.name: CLKGEN_STATUS
register.comment: This register returns the instantaneous status of the various deep sleep wakeup sources, along with the deep sleep mode bit and the status of the slow clock

register.name: CLKGEN_CLK_REQ_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_CLK_REQ_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_CLK_REQ_ENABLES
register.comment: This register enables clock requests to have an effect. If these bits are cleared, the clock request from the corresponding block is ignored

register.name: CLKGEN_CLK_REQ_STATUS
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_BB_CLK_REQ_STATUS
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_LDPC_CLK_REQ_STATUS
register.comment: This register allows the firmware to see the instantaneous state of the clock request lines from the various subsystems to assist in deciding whether the hardware is really idle or just pausing briefly

register.name: CLKGEN_VITERBI_PRESCALE_CFG
register.comment: Register to set 480MHz clock prescaling before it is used to create viterbi clock. Default divides by 1,1,2,4,8 in 80/40/20/10/5 MHz modes. May need faster viterbi clock for Green Field LDPC modes than default

register.name: CLKGEN_VITERBI_SCALE_CFG
register.comment: Register to divide prescaled 480MHz clock to create viterbi clock. The 3 bits for each rate are the number of clocks-1 in each 8 passed to the viterbi. Default gives 7 clocks in every 8 to viterbi

register.name: SPEEDY_ADDR_CTRL
register.comment: Address and control flags for a Speedy transaction. Write this register to create an APB cycle on the remote chip (set up the write data first for write cycles). NOTE: usage of bit 19 (spare)

register.name: SPEEDY_WRITE_DATA
register.comment: Data to write to APB over Speedy

register.name: SPEEDY_READ_DATA
register.comment: Data read back for APB over Speedy

register.name: SPEEDY_APB_STATUS
register.comment: Status of the current APB cycle

register.name: BB_CONTROL_MAC_STATUS
register.comment: Status register showing the current value of the private MAC BB_CONTROL register

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_CONFIG
register.comment: Config for PAPR module

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_CONFIG2
register.comment: Config for Tx filtering stages and papr

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_CONFIG3
register.comment: time delay Config for Tx duplicate mode peak reduction

register.name: BASEBAND_SCAN_ACC_CONFIG
register.comment: configuration for scan accelerator

register.name: BASEBAND_TX_EVM_PARAMS
register.comment: Used to tune the gain in the upsample filters in preproc to enhance the Evm across the preproc

register.name: BB_LEG_DUP_DET_CONFIG
register.comment: Contains parameters used for Non-HT Duplicate detection for 40MHz mode.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_START_STATUS
register.comment: The start time of the OFDM transmit packet, relative to the hardware timer, in units of 400 ns. For packets having a preamble, this points to the beginning of that preamble.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_TYPE
register.comment: Packet type : should be set to TYPE_80211A for 11a/n. See definition of BB_PACK_TYPE for value.

register.name: BB_TX_PREAMB_TYPE
register.comment: Packet preamble type : should be set to PRE_80211A for 11a/n. See definition of BB_PREAMBLE_TYPE for value.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_RATE_STATUS
register.comment: Packet type, rate and channel bandwidth.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_RATE_EXT_STATUS
register.comment: extend bits of BB_TX_PACK_RATE_STATUS for 11ac.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_OPTIONS_STATUS
register.comment: Packet transmit options.

register.name: BB_TX_SIGNAL_FIELD_STATUS
register.comment: Signal field.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_SCAN_CONFIG_STATUS
register.comment: Scan accelerator configuration.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_PLEN_1_STATUS
register.comment: For Hiperlan2: The number of OFDM symbols in the first data part of the packet. For 802.11a: bit 0 is bit 10 of N_data, where N_data is the number of OFDM symbols in the 'Data' part of the burst. Bits [8:1] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last OFDM symbol, including the 6 tail bits. For 802.11n non-STBC: bits [10:0] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last OFDM symbol, including the 6 tail bits. For 802.11n STBC: bits [10:0] contain the number of bits transmitted in the last pair of OFDM symbols, including the 6 tail bits.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_PLEN_2_STATUS
register.comment: For Hiperlan 2: The number of OFDM symbols in the second data part of the packet. For 802.11a: Bits [9:0] contain bits [9:0] of N_data. For 802.11n: Bits [14:0] contain [bits [14:0] of] N_data. Bit 15 indicates LDPC Extra OFDM symbol.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_P1_START
register.comment: Bit 0 is one if the first data part of the packet has P1 puncturing, else is zero. Bit 1 is one if the second data part of the packet has P1 puncturing, else is zero. 11a/n does not use P1 puncturing.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_TYPE
register.comment: Bit 0 indicates the CRC type for the first data part of the burst (0 = CRC16, 1 = CRC24). Bit 1 indicates the CRC type for the second data part of the burst

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_PERIOD_STATUS
register.comment: For Hiperlan2: The CRC period i.e. the number of bytes over which the CRC is computed within each of the data parts of the packet. Bits [5:0] are the CRC period for the first data part of the packet, bits [11:6] are the CRC period for the second part. For 802.11a and 802.11n: The number of bytes of the payload, including the four CRC32 bytes.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_CRC_N_PERIODS
register.comment: The number of CRC periods in each part of the packet. Bits [7:0] - the number of CRC periods in the first part of the packet. Bits [15:8] - the number of CRC periods in the second part of the packet.

register.name: BB_TX_WARMUP
register.comment: The TX warmup time, in units of 400 ns.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_MASK
register.comment: Interrupt mask register. Setting a bit in this register against an interrupt cause bit position, ensures that it generates an interrupt.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_CAUSE
register.comment: Interrupt cause register. Read by the host to determine why it was interrupted.

register.name: BB_TX_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt clear register. Writing a one to an interrupt cause bit position clears the associated bit in the BB_**_INT_CAUSE register.

register.name: BB_TX_TIMING
register.comment: Tx timing adjust control to allow correction for TX latency

register.name: BB_RX_INT_MASK
register.comment: Interrupt mask register. Setting a bit in this register against an interrupt cause bit position, ensures that it generates an interrupt.

register.name: BB_RX_INT_CAUSE
register.comment: Interrupt cause register. Read by the host to determine why it was interrupted.

register.name: BB_RX_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt clear register. Writing a one to an interrupt cause bit position clears the associated bit in the BB_**_INT_CAUSE register.

register.name: BB_TX_PACK_QUEUE
register.comment: The number of packets queued for TX by the host and not yet completed.

register.name: BB_RX_PACK_QUEUE
register.comment: The number of packets queued for RX by the host and not yet completed.

register.name: BB_CARRIER_CHANNEL
register.comment: Should be programmed to the channel number corresponding to the carrier frequency. In the 5 GHz band, Carrier frequency = [channel_no*5+5000 MHZ, for channel_no = 0..200, 5000-(256-channel_no)*5 MHz, for channel_no=201..255]. For operation in the 2.4 GHz band, bit TRACK_2400_MHZ (for MAIN) or TRACK_2400_MHZ_SEC (for SEC) of register BB_RX_CONFIG should be set to one; then the carrier frequency is half the one for the 5 GHz band for the same channel number.

register.name: BB_TX_SCRAMBLER_SEED
register.comment: Scrambler seed for transmitted bursts. If this register is set to zero, then a pseudo-random scrambler seed is automatically generated for every transmit burst. If this register is set to a non-zero value, then that value is used as the scrambler seed for transmitted bursts.

register.name: BB_RX_CONFIG
register.comment: Receiver configuration

register.name: BB_RX_CONFIG2
register.comment: Receiver configuration

register.name: BB_SIGB_SEGPARS
register.comment: Enable VHTSIGB Segment parsing and deparsing in Transmitter and Receiver

register.name: BB_RX_CONFIG3
register.comment: Receiver configuration

register.name: BB_RX_PLL_COEFFS
register.comment: Frequency tracking PLL coefficients

register.name: BB_RX_DEMAP_METRIC_A
register.comment: Demapper soft-decision metric as used by the Viterbi decoder

register.name: BB_RX_DEMAP_METRIC_B
register.comment: Demapper soft-decision metric as used by the Viterbi decoder

register.name: BB_FREQ_OFFSET
register.comment: Frequency offset for the last received burst

register.name: BB_DUAL_MIX_CONFIG
register.comment: Dual receive configuration - Not applicable for cinderella

register.name: BB_SIGNAL_QUALITY
register.comment: Bits 15:8 - The estimated EVM for the receive channel. Bits 7:0 - The estimated SNR, based on the burst preamble, for the receive channel

register.name: BB_SIGNAL_QUALITY_DUAL
register.comment: Bits 15:8 - The estimated EVM for the dual receive channel. Bits 7:0 - The estimated SNR, based on the burst preamble, for the dual receive channel

register.name: BB_RATE_INDICATOR
register.comment: Indicates, for each of 8 rates, how many sub-carriers are below the level required for 10% Packet Error Rate. It is scaled by the value stored in BB_RATE_CONFIG_SCALE. e.g. BB_RATE_INDICATOR_3=2 and BB_RATE_CONFIG_SCALE=2 means 4 sub-carriers found below the required threshold for MCS3

register.name: BB_RATE_INDICATOR_DUAL
register.comment: Indicates, for each of 8 rates, how many sub-carriers are below the level required for 10% Packet Error Rate on the dual receive channel. It is scaled by the value stored in BB_RATE_CONFIG_SCALE. e.g. BB_RATE_INDICATOR_3=2 and BB_RATE_CONFIG_SCALE=2 means 4 sub-carriers found below the required threshold for MCS3

register.name: BB_RATE_CONFIG
register.comment: Configure what information will be stored in BB_RATE_INDICATOR. This register is considered static and changing this value between collecting and reporting the BB_RATE_INDICATOR is not supported and may lead to unreliable results.

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CONFIG
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decsions on inner carriers (+/-1, +/-2) when estimated frequency offset exceeds certain thresholds OR permanently reduce the reliability on inner carriers regardless of frequency offset.

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_MA_SC_20M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the most affected subcarriers for 20/40MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to -1 -2 and -3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_LA_SC_20M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the less affected subcarriers for 20/40MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to 1 2 and 3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_MA_SC_10M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the most affected subcarriers for 10MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to -1 -2 and -3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_LA_SC_10M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the less affected subcarriers for 10MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to 1 2 and 3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_MA_SC_5M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the most affected subcarriers for 5MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to -1 -2 and -3

register.name: BB_BBA_FREQ_OFFSET_MASK_CFG_LA_SC_5M
register.comment: Reduce the reliability of soft decision on the less affected subcarriers for 5MHz bandwidth(1 2 3 or -1 -2 -3, when offset frequency is positive,, it corresponds to 1 2 and 3

register.name: BB_CTRACK_UNREL
register.comment: Thresholds to define which values of soft bits should disable channel tracking. When above BB_CTRACK_UNREL_LOW_THRESH and below BB_CTRACK_UNREL_HIGH_THRESH on any valid soft bit, channel tracking is disabled for that subcarrier

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_ENABLE
register.comment: Enable soft decision weighting scaling values to be read from the registers instead of default values in the code.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS0
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS0 and MCS1) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for BCC decoder in AWGN channel.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS1
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS0 and MCS1) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS2
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS2 and MCS3) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for BCC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS3
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS2 and MCS3) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS4
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS4 and MCS5) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS5
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS4 and MCS5) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS6
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS6 and MCS7) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS7
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS6 and MCS7) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS8
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS8 and MCS9) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_AWGN_THRESHOLDS9
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS8 and MCS9) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS0
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS0 and MCS1) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for BCC decoder in Fading channel.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS1
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS0 and MCS1) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS2
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS2 and MCS3) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for BCC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS3
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS2 and MCS3) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS4
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS4 and MCS5) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS5
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS4 and MCS5) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS6
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS6 and MCS7) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS7
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS6 and MCS7) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS8
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS8 and MCS9) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_WEIGH_SOFT_BIT_FADING_THRESHOLDS9
register.comment: Thresholds (for MCS8 and MCS9) in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_CHANSHIFT_BCC
register.comment: Channel Shift in the soft decision weighing algorithm for BCC decoder.

register.name: BB_CHANSHIFT_LDPC
register.comment: Channel Shift in the soft decision weighing algorithm for LDPC decoder.

register.name: BB_DEMAP_SHIFT
register.comment: Shift values in soft demapper for 64QAM and 256QAM.

register.name: BB_DEMAP_THRES
register.comment: SNR threshold to apply different shift value in soft demapper for 64QAM and 256QAM.

register.name: BB_DEMAP_CONFIG
register.comment: SNR threshold method enable signal

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_20M_40M
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 20/40MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 122 KHz/20 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_20M_40M
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 20/40MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 50 KHz/20 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_10M
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 10MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 84 KHz/10 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_10M
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 10MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 14 KHz/10 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_HIGH_THRESH_5M
register.comment: the high threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 5MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 75 KHz/5 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_SOFT_WEIGH_FREQ_OFFSET_LOW_THRESH_5M
register.comment: the low threshold value for frequency offset in soft weigh for 5MHz bandwidth, it is derived by 31KHz/5 MHz * 2^16

register.name: BB_PILOT_PHASE_LIMIT
register.comment: Limit the absolute pilot angle correction. This is a 10-bit unsigned number in RTL phase format (max value 512). RTL phase format = (angle in deg / 180) * 512. (Default = 0.4 radians)

register.name: BB_SAMP_OFFSET
register.comment: Sampling offset. Data symbols are sampled at a position -BB_SAMP_OFFSET with respect to the beginning of the data part of the symbol.

register.name: BB_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Select the set of signals output at the debug port

register.name: BB_MIMO_RATE_MASK
register.comment: Control rejection of HT and VHT 40MHz packets with certain MIMO rates

register.name: BB_VHT_SS1_RATE_MASK
register.comment: Control rejection of VHT 80MHz single spatial stream (or STBC) packets with certain rates

register.name: BB_VHT_SS2_RATE_MASK
register.comment: Control rejection of VHT two spatial stream packets with certain rates

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG11
register.comment: synchronizer configuration

register.comment: synchronizer configuration

register.comment: synchronizer configuration

register.comment: synchronizer configuration

register.comment: Lower limit on quantization to avoid excessive AGC action

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG18
register.comment: High limit on quantization to avoid excessive AGC action

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG19
register.comment: Number of samples to advance the start the LTF search window

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG20
register.comment: synchronizer configuration

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG21
register.comment: synchronizer configuration for new new STBC sync

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG22
register.comment: TORO: remove

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG23
register.comment: synchronizer configuration for new new STBC sync

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG24
register.comment: LTF lock limited by distance from max peak

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG25
register.comment: Threshold for comparing the combined STF correlation

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG26
register.comment: Threshold for comparing the combined STF correlation

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG27
register.comment: First and second 40MHz sync split filter

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CONFIG28
register.comment: 80MHz sync split filter

register.name: BB_RX_SYNC_CCA_CFG
register.comment: Configure to take into account the CCA of each 20M subband for the primary channel

register.name: BB_CEST_RE_DATA
register.comment: Real part of data for calibration channel estimation

register.name: BB_CEST_IM_DATA
register.comment: Imaginary part of data for calibration channel estimation

register.name: BB_CEST_LTF_OFFSET
register.comment: 20 MHz Sample offset for values read from BB_CEST_ADDR[8:6]=='000' for an 11a or green-field packet. Value is in 2's complement. Negative values indicate that the LTF sync is earlier than the position indicated by the STF sync.

register.name: BB_CEST_CONFIG
register.comment: Configuration for handling data for calibration

register.name: BB_CEST_STS_MULT
register.comment: Data needed for Space-Time-Stream combination (needed for BB_CEST_CONFIG_MODE='10')

register.name: BB_CEST_STS_PHASE
register.comment: Phase rotation for Space-Time-Stream channel estimate (needed for BB_CEST_CONFIG_MODE='10')

register.name: BB_CEST_MAX
register.comment: Maximum channel estimate value across all Space-Time-Streams (needed to normalise the channel estimates sent for calibration purposes)

register.name: BB_CEST_STATUS
register.comment: Status information for calibration support

register.name: BB_CEST_ADDR
register.comment: Channel estimate value requested

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD1
register.comment: SNR Threshold 1 channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4. If signal SNR is above threshold 1, then filter option 0 is used in channel smoothing.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD2
register.comment: SNR Threshold 2 for channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4. If signal SNR is above threshold 5, then filter option 4 is used in channel smoothing. If below, filter option 5 is used.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD3
register.comment: SNR Threshold 3 for channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4.If signal SNR is above threshold 2, then filter option 1 is used in channel smoothing.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD4
register.comment: SNR Threshold 4 for channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4. If signal SNR is above threshold 3, then filter option 2 is used in channel smoothing.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD5
register.comment: SNR Threshold 5 for channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4. If signal SNR is above threshold 4, then filter option 3 is used in channel smoothing.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTH_SNR_THRESHOLD6
register.comment: SNR Threshold 6 for channel smoothing. To program value, multiply desired SNR (in dB) by 4. If signal SNR is above treshold 5, then filter option 4 is used in channel smoothing. If below, filter option 5 is used.

register.name: BB_MRC_CONFIG_BASIC
register.comment: Control register to configure OFDM Maximum Ratio Combining and Basic MRC block

register.name: BB_MRC_CONFIG_STBC
register.comment: Control register to configure OFDM Maximum Ratio Combining STBC MRC block (used for STBC mode only)

register.name: BB_MRC_CONFIG_STREAM2
register.comment: Control register to configure OFDM Maximum Ratio Combining Stream2 MRC block (used for MCS-32 only)

register.name: BB_MRC_CONFIG_FINAL
register.comment: Control register to configure OFDM Maximum Ratio Combining Final MRC block (used for MCS-32 only)

register.name: BB_MRC_NONCONT_BANDS
register.comment: Control register to whether MRC non contiguous bands or not.

register.name: BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ADDRESS
register.comment: This register is used for the first step of a two stage process to reduce reliability of individual subcarriers. First this register is set to a subcarrier range, and then BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ENABLE is used to select which sub-carrier is being targetted within this range

register.name: BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ENABLE
register.comment: Each bit can enable reduced reliability if set. The sub-carrier affected by each bit is BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ADDRESS+bit_index. e.g. with BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ADDRESS=-16, bit 0 targets sub-carrier -16, bit 1 targets -15 etc.

register.name: BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ENABLE_STATUS
register.comment: Internal values of BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ENABLE can be read by selecting the range using BB_SC_SOFT_WEIGH_ADDRESS and then reading this register. N.B. Sub-carriers that cannot be valid are returned as 0

register.name: BB_DD_CPE_CONFIG
register.comment: Configuration for the Data Directed Common Phase Error calculation

register.name: BB_DD_CPE_CONFIG2
register.comment: Configuration 2 for the Data Directed Common Phase Error calculation

register.name: BB_PTW70_CONFIG
register.comment: Setup to allow detection and control relating to packets with strong phase wobble such as those from PTW70 test equipment

register.name: BB_PTW70_CONFIG2
register.comment: Setup 2 to allow detection and control relating to packets with strong phase wobble such as those from PTW70 test equipment

register.name: BB_RX_RADIO_CS_CONFIG
register.comment: RX Radio CS detection configuration for 80MHz bandwidth

register.name: BB_RX_ENERGY_DET_THRESHOLD
register.comment: RX energy detection threshold for primary and secondary 20MHz channel

register.name: BB_RX_PAYLOAD_DET_THRESHOLD
register.comment: RX payload detection threshold for all subbands

register.name: BB_RX_PAYLOAD_DET_CONFIG
register.comment: Payload Detector enables.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_NGI_CONFIG1
register.comment: First configuration register for the normal guard interval (NGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_NGI_CONFIG2
register.comment: Second configuration register for the normal guard interval (NGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_NGI_CONFIG3
register.comment: Third configuration register for the normal guard interval (NGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_NGI_CONFIG4
register.comment: Fourth configuration register for the normal guard interval (NGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_SGI_CONFIG1
register.comment: First configuration register for the short guard interval (SGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_SGI_CONFIG2
register.comment: Second configuration register for the short guard interval (SGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_SGI_CONFIG3
register.comment: Third configuration register for the short guard interval (SGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_RX_OFDM_DET_SGI_CONFIG4
register.comment: Fourth configuration register for the short guard interval (SGI) correlator within the OFDM Payload Detector.

register.name: BB_BBA_CCA_CFG
register.comment: CCA ignore control on the primary channel, secondary channel, secondary 40 channel and secondary 80 channel.

register.name: BB_BBA_DEBUG
register.comment: Read access to BBA debug information. To see this data correctly, the enable bit BB_DEBUG_SELECT.BB_DEBUG_SELECT_EN must be set, to enable the register supplying this information.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_CONFIG
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_CONFIG2
register.comment: TX beamforming configuration #2.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_STATUS
register.comment: Tx Beamforming module status.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_ADDR
register.comment: This register is used as an index into the beamforming angle store.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_DATAL
register.comment: This register is used to read/write the angle store data.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_DATAU
register.comment: This register is used to read/write the angle store data.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_DATAL_STATUS
register.comment: This register is used to read the angle store data.

register.name: BB_BBA_BF_TX_ANGLE_STORE_DATAU_STATUS
register.comment: This register is used to read the angle store data.

register.name: BB_CEST_SMOOTHING
register.comment: This register is used to control smoothing 1'b0 : Off(No smoothing), 1'b1 : On(Smoothing Active)

register.name: BB_LDPC_CONFIG
register.comment: LDPC configuration

register.name: BB_LDPC_RX_THROTTLE_ADDR
register.comment: Address used to load different values to internal register to allow reduced data rate in LDPC output. Address to use is described in BB_LDPC_RX_THROTTLE_ADDR_REF

register.name: BB_LDPC_RX_THROTTLE
register.comment: Address used to load different values to internal register to allow reduced data rate in LDPC output

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_REG_EN
register.comment: Enables the phase reg calculations in RTL

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_MAX
register.comment: Maximum CPE phase of a frame over all symbols

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_MIN
register.comment: Minimum CPE phase of a frame over all symbols

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_ACCUM
register.comment: Phase accumulation of all symbol phase of the frame

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_SQR_ACCUM
register.comment: Accumulation of phase square over all symbols of the frame

register.name: BB_CPE_PHASE_DIFF_ACCUM
register.comment: Accumulation of phase difference over all symbols of the frame

register.name: BB_CPE_NUM_ACCUM
register.comment: Number of phases accumulated in the accumulation registers

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_REG_EN
register.comment: Enables the frequency reg calculations in RTL

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_MAX
register.comment: Maximum fine frequency of a frame over all symbols

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_MIN
register.comment: Minimum fine frequency of a frame over all symbols

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_ACCUM
register.comment: Fine frequency accumulation of all symbol phase of the frame

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_SQR_ACCUM
register.comment: Accumulation of fine frequency square over all symbols of the frame

register.name: BB_FREQ_TRACK_NUM_ACCUM
register.comment: Number of fine frequency accumulated in the accumulation registers

register.name: BB_EN_VHT_NUDGEAGAIN
register.comment: Enable nudge again for HT/VHT packets otherwise nudge again only for HT packets

register.name: BBB_TX_BURST_RATE_STATUS
register.comment: Transmit burst status information: rate and duplicate mode config for DSSS/CCK (a non-standard feature)

register.name: BBB_TX_BURST_OPTIONS_STATUS
register.comment: Packet transmit options.

register.name: BBB_TX_BURST_SCAN_CONFIG_STATUS
register.comment: Scan accelerator configuration.

register.name: BBB_RX_FILTER_CONFIG
register.comment: 40 to 44MHz resampling filter settings. These settings are applied to the two instances of this filter module, for I and Q signals.

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_PKT_CONFIG
register.comment: Configures detection of SFD (Start Frame Delimiter), aka Packet Sync

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_CONFIG3
register.comment: Configuration of CCK symbol synchronizer with pattern matching criteria (See B-65913)

register.name: BBB_RX_SYNC_SYM_CONFIG4
register.comment: More configuration related to CCK symbol synchronizer with pattern matching criteria (See B-65913 and B-77346)

register.name: BBB_RX_DIVERSITY_CFG
register.comment: Configuration for DSSS/CCK switched diversity reception

register.name: BBB_RX_DIVERSITY_CHOP_PERIOD

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENCR_TYPE

register.comment: Frame header length in octets

register.name: ENC_DMA_ENC_CONFIG
register.comment: Contains the following configuration bits:

register.name: ENC_DMA_PRIORITY_OCTET
register.comment: Priority octet used in TKIP MIC calculation. Set to zero in this case. For CCMP operation, bits set to 1 in this octet will be set to one in the Nonce Flags Octet. It should be set to 0x10 for Management frames but should be set to 0xFF for Cisco CCX S67 compatibility; it must be set to 0x0 otherwise. (Refer to 802.11w section 8.3.3.3.3)

register.name: ENC_DMA_FC_MASK
register.comment: Frame Control Mask. Determines which Frame Control bits are masked (i.e. included in the AAD calculation) in CCMP mode. Its default value is 0xC78F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2)

register.name: ENC_DMA_AAD_QC_MASK
register.comment: Additional Authentication Data QoS Control field mask value for CCMP encryption. Set to 0x0F unless both the STA and its peer have their SPP A-MSDU Capable fields set to 1. In that case, set to 0x8F. (Refer to 802.11n section 8.3.3.3.2 g)

register.name: ENC_DMA_STROBE
register.comment: Contains the following bits:

register.name: ENC_DMA_QUEUE_STATUS
register.comment: Bits [3:2] contain the number of operations currently in progress. The processor must read this number before programming any configuration registers, and may write configuration registers only when this number is less than 2. Bits [1:0] contain the number of sets of status registers in the status queue.

register.name: ENC_DMA_OPERATION_STATUS
register.comment: Indicates the outcome of the corresponding encryption operation. One of: ENC_DONE, ENC_STATUS_MIC_FAIL (MIC failed) ,ENC_DMA_DONE (DMA operation has been finished),AXI_READ_SLAVE_ERROR,AXI_READ_DECODE_ERROR,AXI_WRITE_SLAVE_ERROR,AXI_WRITE_ DECODE _ERROR

register.comment: Queue sizes numbers 0, 1, 2 and 3.

register.comment: The firmware can read from this register the NAV end time.

register.name: MAC_TXOPHOLDER_BYTE3_0

register.name: MAC_NAV_SRC
register.comment: NAV sources. See 802.11-1999 as amended in 802.11-2007.

register.name: MAC_RADIO_INFO_TIMING_ADJUST
register.comment: Timing adjustment to register useful information from Radio.

register.name: MAC_CCA_TXCONFIRM_TO_END_11B
register.comment: Measured in 50ns units: Time from TxConfirm to end of Tx packet plus Rx latency for 802.11b.

register.name: MAC_CCA_TXCONFIRM_TO_END_11A
register.comment: Measured in 50ns units: Time from TxConfirm to end of Tx packet plus Rx latency for 802.11a.

register.name: MAC_CCA_TXEND_REF_EARLY0_11A
register.comment: Measured in 50ns units: Early TxEnd reference measured down from MAC_CCA_TXCONFIRM_TO_END_11A for use with RIFS.

register.name: MAC_CCA_TXEND_REF_EARLY1_11A
register.comment: Measured in 50ns units: Early TxEnd reference measured down from MAC_CCA_TXCONFIRM_TO_END_11A for use with RIFS.

register.name: MAC_RESPONSE_DELAY_SIFS
register.comment: Bits 5 down to 0 are programmable time in 25ns units to delay response frames such that SIFS is met. Bit 6 allows timing at the end of HT-MM short GI frames to be measured on 4us symbol boundaries. This affects SIFS timing of short GI frames.

register.name: MAC_TXCONFIRM_TO_END
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between TxConfirm and the end of the Tx packet.

register.name: MAC_RXLATENCY
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between end of Rx packet and end of reception indication in the Macacc.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_RXLATENCY
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between end of Rx packet and end of reception.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_RXLATENCY_FINE
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that measures the time between end of packet and end of reception. This is used in conjunction with MAC_CSTATE_RXLATENCY to produce finer resolution.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_TXEND_LATENCY
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between end of Tx packet and end of transmission indication in the Macacc.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_RXEND_LATENCY
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between end of Rx packet and end of reception indication in the Macacc.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_TXDELAY
register.comment: Programmable time in us that measures the time between MAC decides to transmit and the data appearing on air.

register.name: MAC_CSTATE_SLOT_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the time between SLOT and SLOT_EARLY.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_START_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the symbol start time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_SYMB_END_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_STBC_WITH_LDPC_SYMB_END_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE for a received frame containing both STBC and LDPC (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_STBC_LDPC_SYMB_END_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50us units that adjusts the symbol end time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE for STBC or LDPC reception (+/-) for OFDM.

register.name: MAC_PHYIF_RXSTART_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 1us unit that adjusts the RX_START start time in MAC_PHY_INTERFACE.

register.name: MAC_TX_CTSTOSELF_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the CTS-to-self Tx time.

register.name: MAC_TX_CTSRESPONSE_ADJUST
register.comment: Programmable time in 50ns units that adjusts the CTS response Tx time.

register.name: MAC_PHY_RXSTART_DELAY_11A_11N
register.comment: Programmable time in us that defines the PHY-RX-START-Delay time for 11a and 11n.

register.name: MAC_PHY_RXSTART_DELAY_11B
register.comment: Programmable time in us that defines the PHY-RX-START-Delay time for 11b.

register.name: MAC_RX_AMPDU_CFG
register.comment: Receive A-MPDU configuration.

register.name: MAC_SEC_CHAN_CLEAR_TIME
register.comment: Secondary Channel must be free for this amount of time (50ns unit) before it is declared non-busy for starting a Txop.

register.name: MAC_SEC_CHAN_CLEAR_TIME_CTS
register.comment: The bottom 10 bits means secondary channel must be free for this amount of time (50ns unit) before it is declared non-busy for CTS response to a RTS signalling TA. Bits [13:10] is a signed number that adjusts the delay between the start of frame and the synchronisation start pulse from the modem.

register.name: MAC_TX_DELAY_FINE_TUNE
register.comment: Transmit delay fine tune. Provides fine adjustment of inter-frame spacing.

register.name: MAC_CS_LATENCY
register.comment: CS latency in units of 50 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive.

register.name: MAC_RADIO_SYNC_LATENCY
register.comment: Radio sync latency in units of 50 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive.

register.name: MAC_MODEM_SYNC_LATENCY
register.comment: Modem sync latency in units of 50 ns: time that medium is still marked busy after CS becomes inactive.

register.name: MAC_DEFAULT_AMPDU_DURATION
register.comment: This is the duration of an A-MPDU frame exchange when it is the next frame from the frame at the head of a queue.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_FCS_ERROR_COUNT
register.comment: Received frame FCS error counter.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_FCS_GOOD_COUNT
register.comment: Received frame FCS good counter.

register.name: MAC_BAD_SIG_COUNT
register.comment: Received frame bad signal counter.

register.name: MAC_TX_UNDER_COUNT
register.comment: TX frames which were corrupted by the accelerator due to TX underflow.

register.name: MAC_AC_BK_TIME_SPENT
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_BK queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_OCTETS_IN_AMPDUS
register.comment: Counts of the number of octets received in AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDUS_COUNT
register.comment: Counts of the number of received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_MPDUS_IN_AMPDUS_COUNT
register.comment: Counts of the number of MPDUs received in AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_DOT11_RX_AMPDU_DELIM_CRC_ERR_COUNT
register.comment: Counts the number of errors in MPDU CRC delimiters found in received AMPDUs.

register.name: MAC_AC_BE_TIME_SPENT
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_BE queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_AC_VI_TIME_SPENT
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_VI queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_AC_VO_TIME_SPENT
register.comment: This register counts the time spent transmitting from the AC_VO queue, in units of 16 us.

register.name: MAC_TXRX_TIME_SPENT

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START
register.comment: Address of start of Receive Buffer. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Receive Buffer. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_GIVE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Write Pointer (updated only at Receive Dollop boundaries)

register.name: MAC_IF_RX_BUFFER_TAKE
register.comment: Receive Buffer Read Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 0. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 0. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 0 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_SPACE
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 0. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER0_TRIGGER
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 0 is greater than this. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 1. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 1. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 1 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_SPACE
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 1. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER1_TRIGGER
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 1 is greater than this. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 2. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 2. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 2 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_SPACE
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 2. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER2_TRIGGER
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 2 is greater than this. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_START
register.comment: Address of start of Transmit Buffer 3. Multiple of 1k. Address = MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_START*1024. Since MAC IF is connected 'directly' to RAMSW, value of 0x00_0000 => start of RAMSW

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_SIZE
register.comment: Size of Transmit Buffer 3. Units of 1k bytes. Offset of 1k bytes. 0 => 1k bytes, 1 => 2k bytes, 63 => 64k bytes

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_GIVE
register.comment: Transmit Buffer 3 Write Pointer

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_SPACE
register.comment: Number of bytes of free space in Transmit Buffer 3. Two lsb always 0. Note that when a MAC frame is transmitted using RTS/CTS protection, then the MAC ACC will rewind the Transmit Buffer Read Pointer by four words. Thus the value in this register may be sixteen greater than the space actually available

register.name: MAC_IF_TX_BUFFER3_TRIGGER
register.comment: Generate interrupt when free space in Transmit Buffer 3 is greater than this. Two lsb ignored and treated as 0

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Raw Status register. This is a 'sticky' register. The (transient) interrupt sources can (only) set the bits to 1. Bits may be cleared to 0 by writing to MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR. When the MAC IF is Disabled, the interrupt sources are prevented from updating INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_STATUS
register.comment: Interrupt Status register. Value in this register is MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS ANDed with MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE. If one or more of the bits in this register are 1, then the interrupt output signal from the MAC IF will be asserted

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_ENABLE
register.comment: Interrupt Enable register. Allows the various interrupt sources to be enabled / masked. If masked (i.e. a bit is a 0), then the interrupt source will not cause an interrupt, but the source may still be polled via MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS

register.name: MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_CLEAR
register.comment: Interrupt Clear register. Writing a 1 to a bit will clear (set to 0) the corresponding bit in MAC_IF_INTERRUPT_RAW_STATUS. Writing a 0 has no effect. The clear only lasts for one clock cycle; there is no need to write a 0 after writing a 1

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_SELECT
register.comment: Debug Select

register.name: MAC_IF_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug Status

register.name: WL_RADIO_DEBUG_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the selection of debug buses to be driven out of the module.

register.name: WL_RADIO_LOG_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the data logging features within the Radio Control block

register.name: WL_RADIO_LOCATION_LOG_CONTROL
register.comment: This register controls the data logging trigger when in location mode

register.name: WL_RADIO_LOG_TX_TRIGGER_FILTER
register.comment: This register controls the data TX logging trigger filter mode

register.name: WL_RADIO_MMU_TX_SIGGEN_CTRL
register.comment: This register controls the RAM based signal generator.

register.name: WL_RADIO_ANA_TX_CTRL_TEST
register.comment: This register allows registers to be set directly for test. Updates do not wait for the start of a packet.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_ANA_OFDM_SEL
register.comment: This register selects which of the 2 OFDM settings are used for each OFDM mode for the Tx analogue settings that vary with modulation scheme

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_SF_OFDM_SEL
register.comment: This register selects which of the 2 OFDM settings are used for each OFDM mode for the spectral shaping filter that vary with modulation scheme

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG_CCK
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - CCK modulation

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG2_CCK
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - CCK modulation

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG_OFDM0
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - OFDM modulations selecting option 0 in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_SF_OFDM_SEL

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG2_OFDM0
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - OFDM modulations selecting option 0 in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_SF_OFDM_SEL

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG_OFDM1
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - OFDM modulations selecting option 1 in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_SF_OFDM_SEL

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_SPECT_SHAPE_FILT_CONFIG2_OFDM1
register.comment: Configuration for the transmit spectrum shaping filter - OFDM modulations selecting option 1 in WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_SF_OFDM_SEL

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_CTRL_CONFIG
register.comment: This register controls the operation of the transmitter power control, in particular whether the variable settings based on the modulation scheme are enabled.

register.name: WL_RADIO_LOGGING_STATUS
register.comment: This read-only register returns logging status.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGGEN_ENABLES
register.comment: Centeral enables for the signal generators and analysers so that they can be enabled at the same time or independently.

register.name: WL_RADIO_ANT_CONFIG
register.comment: This register controls the configuration of the antenna select signal. It is routed out through the front end control block to external hardware

register.name: WL_RADIO_CONFIG
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits

register.name: WL_RADIO_TEMP_CTRL_CONFIG
register.comment: Control register for block interfacing to analogue temperature sensor

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_MIMO_CONFIG
register.comment: Select the AGC strategy for MIMO

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_BUFFER_WRITE_ADDRESS
register.comment: This register is the write address in the shared memory in bytes. After data capture has finished, this will point to the last write address which is required to unroll the circular buffer.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_BUFFER_READ_ADDRESS
register.comment: This register is the read address in the shared memory in bytes. After ram pattern data transfer has finished.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_READ_BASE_ADDRESS
register.comment: Shared memory buffer base address for pattern generation in units of 512 bytes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_WRITE_BASE_ADDRESS
register.comment: Shared memory buffer base address for logged capture data in units of 512 bytes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_READ_ADDRESS_MASK
register.comment: Shared memory buffer mask in units of 512 bytes

register.name: WL_RADIO_AHB_WRITE_ADDRESS_MASK
register.comment: Shared memory buffer mask in units of 512 bytes

register.name: WL_RADIO_LOGGING_TIMER
register.comment: logging period in 20 MHz clock periods

register.name: WL_RADIO_CLOCK_CONTROL
register.comment: Enable/disable Radio Clocks

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG1_I0
register.comment: This register contains the Low Power Tx compensation values that are used for magnitude compensation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG4_I0
register.comment: This register contains the High Power Tx compensation values that are used for magnitude compensation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: This register is a logical extension of WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG1 and contains additional Tx compensation values - low power mode

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG3_I0
register.comment: Additional Tx compensation value used for phase imbalance correction

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG5_I0
register.comment: This register is a logical extension of WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_CONFIG1 and contains additional Tx compensation values - high power mode

register.name: WL_RADIO_TX_COMP_DELAY_CONFIG_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGGEN_FREQ1_I0
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the primary (only) tone used by the signal generator. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by 80 000 000.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGGEN_FREQ2_I0

register.comment: This register has two functions: it is the value preloaded into the accumulator used to generate the first tone, so can set the phase of that tone relative to the second tone or the signal analyser tone. Also, it is used to provide the DC level in that mode of operation

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_AUTO_COEFFS_I0
register.comment: The current values of automatic I/Q trims can be read back from this register. The trim values are in sign/magnitude format. The phase trim is in the upper 8 bits and the amplitude trim in the lower 8 bits of this register. By setting the WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_LUT_READ_EN bit in the WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_CONFIG1 register, entries in the compensation table can also be read.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGANAL_OUTPUT_I0
register.comment: This register contains the values generated by the signal analyser, and consists of two 8 bit fields in the two bytes.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGANAL_RSSI_I0
register.comment: This register contains the RSSI too loud indications collected while the signal analyser was running. Bits set in this register mean that the corresponding signal analyser output may be unreliable

register.name: WL_RADIO_DIG_GAIN_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the current gain settings to all digital blocks in the receive chain

register.name: WL_RADIO_CHANNEL_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the instantaneous value of the RSSI, CCA and CS of this receive chain

register.name: WL_RADIO_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG1_I0
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: WL_RADIO_LNA_PHASE_COMP_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Configuration for LNA phase compensation - WL LNA.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_NOTCH_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register configures the two notch filters in each of the receive chains. The lower 5 bits configure the OFDM filter and the next 5 bits the CCK filter. The MSB enables the notch filter in front of the rx_ctrl module

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_NOTCH_PRELOAD_I0
register.comment: This is the value loaded into the memory element of the notch filters if requested

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_CONFIG1_I0
register.comment: This register controls phase and magnitude compensation for the receive signals in the first receive chain, and has a bit which enables frequency compensation for both receive chains.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Configuration parameters for the averaging block in the Rx IQ Compensation measurement block

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_DELAY_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register controls the receiver delay compensation parameters

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_PHASE_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Configuration for receiver phase compensation

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_COMP_AMPL_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: Configuration for receiver amplitude compensation

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_NOTCH_EQ_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register controls the function of the notch equaliser for CCK.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGANAL_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register configures the signal analyser, all except for the enable, which is controlled by RADIO_SIGGEN_CONFIG.

register.name: WL_RADIO_SIGANAL_FREQ_I0
register.comment: This sets the frequency of the tone used by the signal analyser. The value for a given frequency can be found by multiplying by 65 536 and dividing by 80 000 000.This sets the frequency of the tone used by the signal analyser.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_I_MONITOR_I0
register.comment: This register reads the I sample from the ADC

register.name: WL_RADIO_RX_Q_MONITOR_I0
register.comment: This register reads the Q sample from the ADC

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Writing this register clears any interrupts whose corresponding bits are set in the write data. Bit allocations are as for WL_RADIO_INT_MASK.

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: This register masks events from causing interrupts. Only those interrupts whose mask bit is set will be delivered to the processors

register.name: WL_RADIO_INT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. Bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WL_RADIO_RF_INT_CLEAR_I0
register.comment: Writing this register clears any interrupts whose corresponding bits are set in the write data. Bit allocations are as for WL_RADIO_INT_MASK.

register.name: WL_RADIO_RF_INT_MASK_I0
register.comment: This register masks events from causing interrupts. Only those interrupts whose mask bit is set will be delivered to the processors

register.name: WL_RADIO_RF_INT_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register has bits set in it for any interrupt that is currently active. Bits are set for any active interrupt, whether it is masked or not

register.name: WLRF_TEMP_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the temperature measurements from the RF chip via speedy

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT0_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: This register sets the radio enables for transmit timer slot 0.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT0_DELAY_I0
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 0 becoming active in 50ns units

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT1_DELAY_I0
register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 1 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will roll over, increasing the slot delay.

register.comment: This register sets the delay from Tx timer enable to slot 2 becoming active in 50ns units. NOTE that if the delay is less than the previous slot, the timer will roll over, increasing the slot delay.

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT_ON_OFF_LAST_I0
register.comment: This register sets the start and end of Tx turn on and off ramps, and the slot jumped to in the case of a Tx abort

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT0_ENABLES_I0

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT_ON_OFF_LAST_I0
register.comment: This register sets the start and end of Rx turn on and off ramps, and the slot jumped to in the case of an Rx abort

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_TX_SLOT_I0
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Tx timer

register.name: WL_RADIO_TIMER_RX_SLOT_I0
register.comment: This register contains the current slot selected by the Rx timer

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This register contains the current values of the Radio Enables, after all masking and multiplexing

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_I0
register.comment: Default values for radio enables signals should the mask register select this rather than the timer outputs

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_MASK_I0
register.comment: Selects use of RADIO_ENABLES or timer outputs. A one in a given bit selects the timer output.

register.name: WL_RADIO_ENABLES_TX_TRAIN_MASK_I0
register.comment: Selects use of RADIO_ENABLES or timer outputs. A one in a given bit selects the timer output. Used only when predistort training is active to allow Rx blocks to be turned on

register.name: WL_RADIO_DEBUG_STATUS_I0
register.comment: This read-only register returns the current state of the debug bus within radio control.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG1_I0
register.comment: Miscellaneous config bits for the AGC as follows:

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG2_I0
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: gains ranges definition. valid when AGC is active, and gain not forced.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG3_I0
register.comment: Configuration bits for the AGC: gains ranges definition. valid when AGC is active, and gain not forced. This register has a bad reset value, so must be written by firmware

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG4_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: gain ranges definition.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG5_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC: gain ranges definition.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CONFIG8_I0
register.comment: Further configuration bits for the AGC. RSSI and interference detection related.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_TIMEOUT_I0
register.comment: This register specifies programmable timeouts for the AGC

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_OFDM_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an OFDM receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_AGC_CCK_RSSI_TARGET_I0
register.comment: This register specifies the RSSI target for an CCK receive burst after decimation.

register.name: WL_RADIO_CS_CONFIG_I0
register.comment: This register configures the carrier sense. It is flagged when analogue gain is less than a threshold and digital RSSI is greater than a threshold. The thresholds are set in this register

register.name: WL_MAC_BLOCK_ENABLES
register.comment: Enables for various features within the Mac Accelerator block

register.name: WL_ENC_BLOCK_ENABLES
register.comment: Enables for various aspects of the encryption block

register.name: WL_BB_BLOCK_ENABLES
register.comment: Enables for various parts of the modems

register.name: WL_RADIO_BLOCK_ENABLES
register.comment: Enables for various parts of the radio control block

register.name: WL_BW_CONFIG
register.comment: Default configuration is 20MHz maximum bandwidth with 2 receive and transmit antennae.

register.name: WL_BW_CONFIG_SEC
register.comment: Used for the second modem when configured for true concurrency. Default configuration is 20MHz maximum bandwidth with 2 receive and transmit antennae.

register.name: WL_PARAMETERS
register.comment: Read-only register with modem HW config parameters

register.name: WL_BB_INT_CLEAR
register.comment: Write this register to clear interrupts on corresponding bits

register.name: WL_BB_INT_STATUS
register.comment: Status register indicating which baseband interrupt(s) have occurred. Note that interrupts are not maskable at this level- they are masked within the modems

register.name: WL_DEBUG_SEL
register.comment: Select for WLan_pd level debug mux

register.name: WL_DEBUG_STATUS
register.comment: Debug data at WLan_pd level
